alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 6:10PM CDT until April 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, McDonald, Newton and Stone. * WHEN...Until 600 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145, Flat Creek at Highway U, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Bentonville Hollow at Highway E and Flat Creek at Highway C. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Seligman, Exeter, Wheaton, Washburn, Shell Knob, Butterfield and Golden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
